Here‚Äôs a quick tour of what you can do and the permissions we‚Äôll need to make your experience seamless.
Notifications are essential for sending you medication reminders on time. Please grant permission to ensure you never miss a dose.
To ensure your reminders are precise and timely, even when the app is not active, we need permission to schedule exact alarms.
For critical reminders, allowing full-screen notifications ensures you see them immediately, even if your device is locked or you\'re using another app.
Thanks for setting up all the necessary permissions. You\'re now ready to use Medication Reminder to its full potential.

It\'s normal for your weight to fluctuate due to aspects such as what you eat, when you go to the bathroom and your hydration.
Body temperature refers to the temperature of the body as measured by a thermometer. The body works to maintain body temperature within a small range.

Body temperature refers to the temperature of the body as measured by a thermometer. The body works to maintain body temperature within a small range. According to the World Health Organization, normal body temperature ranges from 36.5 to 37 ¬∞C. But each person is different.
Body temperature can be affected by various factors, such as age, activities, hormones, time of day, illness and the menstrual cycle.
Body temperature can be checked with a thermometer. You can record your results manually or sync them from a compatible device.
The body mass index (BMI) is the relationship between your weight and height.
Body fat percentage refers to the proportion of your body weight that is fat.
Lean mass is made up of muscles, organs, bones, and body water.
Differences between body temperature and skin temperature variation

Body temperature is measured with a thermometer and reflects the temperature inside the body. The variation of the cutaneous temperature is the fluctuation of the temperature of the skin taken in the wrist while you sleep.

This function is not intended to diagnose or monitor serious diseases or medical conditions. Check with your healthcare provider if you have questions about your health or what your body temperature readings in general mean.
Are you sure you want to delete all water entries? This action cannot be undone.
Are you sure you want to delete all weight data? This action cannot be undone.

Welcome to d4viddf.com. This Privacy Policy describes how your personal information is collected, used, and protected when you visit our website, contact us through our web form, or use our applications (hereinafter, \"Services\"). Your privacy is important to us.
We may collect information in various ways depending on how you interact with our Services:
Information you provide directly to us:
Through the contact form on our website: If you contact us using the form on d4viddf.com, we will collect your first name, last name, and email address to manage and respond to your inquiry.
Through our applications: Certain applications may require you to enter information for their operation, as detailed in specific sections (e.g., PillPal).
Information that is automatically collected when you use our Services:
We may collect limited information about your device or application usage anonymously or in aggregate to improve our services, but always prioritizing your privacy.
The information we collect is used to:
Provide, operate, and maintain our Services.
Respond to your inquiries and requests: If you contact us through the web form, we will use your first name, last name, and email to communicate with you and address your request.
Improve, personalize, and expand our Services.
Understand and analyze how you use our Services.
Develop new products, services, features, and functionalities.

Communicate with you, either directly or through one of our partners, including for customer service (in addition to responses to the contact form), to provide you with updates and other information related to the Service, and for informational purposes.
3. Specific Section for the PillPal Application
PillPal is designed to help you manage your medication reminders. The information this application handles is described below:
Frequency of intake (e.g., every 8 hours, once a day).
These data are entered manually by you, the user, through a form within the application. No information is collected automatically without your direct action.
The sole purpose of collecting this data is to allow the PillPal application to generate and manage the medication reminders you configure.
All information about your medications that you enter in PillPal is stored exclusively locally on your mobile device. We do not have access to this information.
Access, Editing, and Deletion of Data in PillPal:

You have full control over your data. You can edit or delete the information for each medication directly from the corresponding medication information screen within the application. By deleting a medication, all its associated information is erased from your device.
Regarding the information from the contact form on our website, we take measures to protect it while it is under our control (e.g., in our email system or inquiry database).

For most of our applications, and specifically for PillPal as detailed above, the data you enter is stored locally on your device. This means we do not store copies of your personal data from these applications on our servers.
We take reasonable measures to protect the information we handle, but no security system is impenetrable.
Currently, we do not share your personal information with third parties. The information collected through the contact form is used solely for the purposes described in this policy.

In the future, for the PillPal application, we might offer an optional feature for users to save and synchronize their medication data with cloud services like Firebase. This feature will be completely optional. If you decide to use it, you will be asked for your explicit consent and provided with detailed information on how your data will be handled before you activate such a feature. Without your explicit consent, your PillPal data will continue to be stored only locally on your device.
As applicable and in accordance with the functionality of each application or service, and applicable law, you have the right to:
Access the personal information we hold about you (e.g., the data you submitted through the contact form or the data in PillPal).
Request the deletion of your personal information.

In PillPal, as mentioned, you can exercise these rights directly from the application. For requests related to the information sent through our website\'s contact form, or for other inquiries, you can contact us.

Our Services are not directed to individuals under the age of 13, and we do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13. Although there is no strict age restriction for the use of PillPal, its use by children under 13 is not recommended without adult supervision. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with personal information (e.g., through the contact form), please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected personal information from a child under 13 without verification of parental consent, we will take steps to remove that information.

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and, where applicable or significant (e.g., for PillPal users), through a notification within the application.
You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you can contact us through:
Review permissions and delete Health Connect data
More information about syncing with Health Connect and common issues
Make the most of Health Connect
To see all your data, give Pillpal permission to read and write data. Pillpal will display data from your other apps, and those apps will be able to access data from Pillpal.
The data you allow Pillpal to read from Health Connect will be available in the Pillpal app, but not on your devices.
If you allow Pillpal to write a type of data in Health Connect, that data will be stored in Health Connect and will be available to your other applications.
For admitted data types, you can choose to have Health Connect data displayed in the app
You will only see data from your PillPal devices and the features of that application
You will see data from both PillPal and Health Connect for admitted data types
If you give PillPal permission to read data, the app can show you the following Health Connect data:
If you choose to display Health Connect data in the app, these data types may no longer match what appears on your PillPal device.
Scores, badges, and leaderboards will continue to use only data from your PillPal devices and features.
Wear OS device connected. Open connection settings.
Wear OS device not connected. Open connection settings.
Open Health Connect to finish disconnecting
PillPal will still have permissions in Health Connect unless you disable them. Open Health Connect to remove PillPal\'s permissions.
Please make sure your watch is nearby and Bluetooth is enabled.
Choose at least one option or add a personalized one
